---

Found the root cause of the deployment-time failure:  
GitHub Actions was running `npm run build`, which triggers a full TypeScript compilation.  
The repo‚Äôs `tsconfig.json` has strict flags (`noUnusedLocals`, `noUnusedParameters`, etc.), so files outside the Worker (e.g. regression demo, security tests) currently don‚Äôt compile cleanly‚Äîthis breaks the workflow even though the Worker itself builds and all Jest tests pass.

Fix implemented:  
`.github/workflows/deploy.yml` now runs the narrow build that produces only the Worker bundle:

```yaml
- name: Build Worker
  run: npm run build:worker
```

Because `wrangler deploy` already executes this same command internally (via the `[build]` section of `wrangler.toml`), this step is just a quick sanity check; it no longer blocks on the broader TypeScript errors.

Next steps you can take if desired  
1. Push the change to `develop`‚Äîthe action should complete successfully and publish to Cloudflare.  
2. (Optional) Clean up the full codebase errors later by either:  
   ‚Ä¢ relaxing `noUnused*` flags for non-worker code, or  
   ‚Ä¢ refactoring/removing unused variables so a full `tsc` passes.  

Let me know if you‚Äôd like help with either of those follow-ups, or if anything else pops up in the deployment logs.

Found the root-cause of the ‚Äú12 000-line‚Äù deploy failure:

‚Ä¢ Wrangler was told to run our custom build script (`[build] command = "npm run build:worker"`).  
‚Ä¢ That script writes `dist/worker.js`.  
‚Ä¢ Immediately afterwards Wrangler‚Äôs own bundler tried to create its output at the exact same path and aborted with  
  ‚Äú‚úò [ERROR] Refusing to overwrite input file "dist/worker.js"‚Äù.

Fix applied:

1. wrangler.toml  
   ‚Äì `main` now points directly at the TypeScript source (`src/worker.ts`).  
   ‚Äì The entire `[build]` section was removed, letting Wrangler handle the compile/bundle itself (no overwrite risk).

2. .github/workflows/deploy.yml  
   ‚Äì The separate ‚ÄúBuild Worker‚Äù step was deleted; Wrangler now performs the compile during `wrangler deploy`.

Local verification:

```
rm -rf dist             # clean slate
npx wrangler build      # ‚úÖ success, no overwrite error
npm run build:worker    # (even if run manually first)
npx wrangler build      # ‚úÖ still succeeds
```

All Jest tests still pass locally.

Next action:

‚Ä¢ Push these two commits to `develop`.  
  The workflow should now complete without errors and your Worker will auto-deploy.

Let me know if you‚Äôd like me to run any further checks or tweak the workflow/documentation!
